intro: Myrmecodendron × hirtipes, commonly known as the hairy myrmecodendron, is a hybrid plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pink flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its unique morphology and growth habits make it an interesting subject for botanical study. It is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often growing in shaded, moist environments.
